title: Maura Higgins shows off dramatic living room makeover
description: The Love Island favourite, 34, has given fans a sneak peek inside her plush £1.25million Essex mansion, unveiling a dramatic living room transformation.
content:
Maura Higgins has given fans a sneak peek inside her plush £1.25million Essex mansion - unveiling a dramatic living room transformation.

The Love Island favourite, 34, shared a before-and-after look with her 3.7million Instagram followers on Monday on her new home Instagram account.

Maura showed how the once sparse space, pictured with just two slouchy white beanbags and a boxed-up TV, has been completely transformed into a snug lounge.

Gone were the empty walls and floors and in their place, a plush white and cream sofa, a matching ottoman, soft rugs, candles and warm lighting.

The Irish beauty, who first shot to fame in 2019, has finally fulfilled her dream of upgrading from her modest one-bed flat to a five-bedroom home.

The upgrade comes after Maura's meteoric rise to fame, from her breakout stint on Love Island to presenting Love Island USA, starring in I'm A Celebrity, and bagging her latest role in The Traitors US.

Speaking about her ambitions, Maura previously said she always knew she wasn't destined to stay in rural County Longford, marry her teenage boyfriend and open a hair salon. 'That wasn't my dream, I wanted more,' she once declared.

Earlier this year, she splashed her hard-earned £3.2million fortune on the luxury pad, which boasts an en-suite master bedroom, four further bedrooms, an expansive kitchen with an island, and black French doors leading to a landscaped garden.

Overjoyed, Maura shared to her Instagram followers a picture of her new kitchen with a chandelier and grey floors, which she bought in October, with the caption 'Bought my dream house'.

Maura's previous home was raided by three-masked men and so the Love Island star has ensured her new home was in a gated development which provides privacy and security.

After first sharing the news of her new home in October, Maura had barely gotten the keys to her new house when she entered the jungle in November for a four-week stint in Australia.

Maura entered the Love Island villa in 2019 and after almost six years in the spotlight with lucrative brand deals, she has amassed a fortune of an estimated £3.2million.

Maura recently shared how she escaped working in a hair salon in Ireland to become a ring girl for the brand Monster against the wishes of her then-boyfriend and dad.

The influencer said: 'I wanted to do more and travel the world. I'm young, why not?'

Her time with Monster caught the eye of ITV recruiters for Love Island, who approached Maura multiple times before she finally accepted as revenge against her boyfriend, which has now landed her a multi-million-pound fortune.

Her big home purchase came after she treated herself to a new £60,000 Porsche just before heading into the I'm A Celebrity jungle in November.

Maura became the proud owner of a Porsche Macan, which typically ranges in price from £60,000 to £98,00.

Sharing a photo from inside her new car, she showed off its luxurious all-white leather interior.

Maura captioned the post: 'My baby has arrived finally,' along with a white heart emoji.

It comes after Maura displayed her toned physique in a summer minidress on the weekend as she shared a glimpse of her lavish lifestyle in an Instagram post.

The former Love Island star, 34, stunned as she enjoyed a picnic in the sun while wearing an ivory and pink milkmaids dress.

In a second image she looked happier than ever after pulling on a pair of thigh-skimming shorts and fedora hat for a bike ride.

Another snap captures Maura enjoying a mint ice cream, while wearing a ruffled dress in a similar colour.

She also shared a glimpse of herself in more casual attire, including a bright pink T-shirt dress branded with the Love Island logo.

The brunette later posed for a fun snap with her pals as they made funny faces for a photo collage.
summary: Maura Higgins, a former Love Island star, has revealed a dramatic transformation inside her £1.25m Essex mansion. The 34-year-old Irish beauty shared a before-and-after look with her 3.7 million Instagram followers on her new home Instagram account. The living room has been completely transformed into a comfortable lounge with a sofa, a matching ottoman, soft rugs, candles, and warm lighting. This comes after Maura's rise to fame, which saw her transition from a modest one-bed flat to a five-bedroom home. She recently splashed her £3.2m fortune on the luxury pad, which also includes an en-suite master bedroom, four further bedrooms, an expansive kitchen with an island, and landscaped garden.
shortSummary: Maura Higgins reveals a dramatic living room transformation in her new £1.25m Essex mansion, celebrating her recent success and newfound wealth.

Maura Higgins looked unrecognisable in a red wig as she posed for a quirky new shoot with Original Magazine on Monday.
The former Love Islander, 34, showcased her striking looks for the project where she looked worlds away from her usual bikini-clad self.
In one snap she rocked the dark red wig, in contrast to her usual sleek brunette locks, and opted for a vampy makeup look complete with a statement lip.
She wore a ruffled black dress as she posed up a storm for the publication - as she spoke about her upcoming stint on the The Traitors USA in the accompanying interview.
In another striking shot she wore a tight leather dress that showed off her figure and accessorised with a huge hat.
She displayed a long black manicure to add to the look as she fixed the camera with a sultry stare.

It was confirmed this month that Maura was in the line-up for the US version of The Traitors.
Speaking about the new project she told the publication: 'It's such a different kind of show for me!
'There's huge game-play drama, strategy… and some seriously big personalities. I can't say too much yet about how it all played out, but let's just say viewers are going to be absolutely hooked. I'm really excited to see it!'
It comes after last week Maura finally fulfilled her life-long 'dream' as she was seen moving out of her humble home into her plush £1.25million mansion in Essex.
The Irish star always dreamed of making big time - and thanks to Love Island - she has amassed an estimated £3.2million after breaking America with huge TV roles.
Maura has taken the showbiz world by storm, presenting Love Island USA, starring in I'm A Celebrity and her latest upcoming gig in The Traitors US.
She always knew she wasn't destined to stay in rural Ireland, marry her teenage boyfriend and open up a hair salon.
'But that's not what I wanted. That was not my dream. That was my father's and boyfriend's dream. I wanted to do more,' Maura defiantly declared.

The girl from remote County Longford splashed her hard-earned cash on a five-bedroom semi-detached house, Daily Mail revealed earlier this year.
Maura has been sharing glimpses of her new abode after finally moving in last month.
She posted a picture of stunning black French doors looking on to a garden, with a huge bouquet of glowers in a vase, Ferrari sparkling wine and a Diptyque candle.
'After the busiest few months... she's finally in,' the former Love Island star captioned the snap.
Sharing another snap of the kitchen featuring her pal, celebrity hairdresser Carl Bembridge, she wrote: 'No chairs yet but he always finds something to sit on.'
Her riches have allowed the presenter to upgrade from her previous one-bedroom property in Essex to one with an en-suite master bedroom with four further rooms.
Overjoyed, Maura shared to her Instagram followers a picture of her new kitchen with a chandelier and grey floors, which she bought in October, with the caption 'Bought my dream house'.
An expansive kitchen, with an island, leads out past the dining area, out bi-folding doors to a large walled garden with a neat lawn.
Maura's previous home was raided by three-masked men and so the Love Island star has ensured her new home was in a gated development which provides privacy and security.

I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! is a British reality television show that debuted in 2002. The show features a group of celebrities who must live together in challenging conditions with minimal comforts. The celebrities participate in various Bushtucker Trials to earn food and luxuries for the camp, while also facing public votes that determine who stays and who leaves.

Love Island fans baffled as 'hypocrite' Maura rages to Mollie-Mae about Elma expressing an interest in new boy Tom... after Ofcom receives 486 complaints over her 'predatory' behaviour
Maura has caused more than her fair share of drama since her explosive arrival in the Love Island villa last week.
Viewers were amused during Monday night's episode of the ITV2 show when the Irish ring girl was seen moaning about Elma expressing an interest in new boy Tom, despite her pal already being coupled up with Anton.
The irony of the situation didn't go unnoticed by fans, who branded Maura a 'hypocrite' for slamming her friend when she had actively tried to seduce Tommy while he was coupled up with Mollie-Mae.
Hypocrite? Love Island viewers took to Twitter on Monday night to criticise Maura for blasting her friend Elma over breaking girl code by expressing an interest in new boy Tom - despite having done the same to Mollie-Mae over Tommy
'I wouldn't do it to any of the other girls. I wouldn't do it!', the brunette beauty lamented to an amused Mollie-Mae, who remained tight-lipped on the matter.
Viewers took to Twitter in their droves to point out how ridiculous her allegations were.
One tweeted: 'Watching Maura have the AUDACITY to moan about Elma after her own recent behaviour #loveisland'.
Another posted: 'How can Maura sit there 'raging' cos the only other guy interested in her is interested in Elma too...'I would never steal a guy off a friend I'm a girls girl' Hun what did you do when you walked in there...!! #DoubleStandards #lovelsland'.
Drama: She was seen moaning about her close pal Elma expressing an interest in new boy Tom (pictured together), despite her being coupled up with Anton
Fan reaction: Amused viewers couldn't believe the 'audacity' Maura showed by complaining
A third amused fan shared a meme of a smug rabbit, writing, 'my face if I was #MollyMae when #Maura started ranting about ##Elma #lovelsland'.
During the latest episode, Maura was seen shooting daggers at Elma when she confessed to the girls in the dressing room that she was open to getting to know model Tom.
Maura took Lucie aside to rage at her co-star's comments.
Upset: Maura declared she was 'f***ing raging' when Elma showed interest in newcomer Tom
She said: 'What f***ing annoys me the most is that she's coupled up with Anton, she has the chance. I'm not coupled up with anyone! I haven't had the chance to couple up with anyone.
'She's supposed to be my f***ing friend, and now am I going to have to fight for him as well? Talk about destroying my confidence!'
Maura continued her rant later in the Beach Hut, where she declared: 'I'm f***ing raging'.
Going on a rant: Maura took Lucie aside to rage at her co-star's comments
Maura's outburst comes as Ofcom has received around 500 complaints about her 'predatory' behaviour towards boxer Tommy Fury - in just two days.
The media watchdog has received 794 complaints since Friday alone, 486 of which relate to Maura's actions as she attempted to plant a kiss on Tommy while lying on top of him which many viewers branded 'desperate' and 'crossing a line' on Twitter.
On Friday viewers saw Maura climb on top of Tommy and try and kiss him, despite him rebuffing her advances out of respect for partner Mollie.
Complaints: Since Friday the watchdog received a total of 794 complaints, 486 of which were related to Maura's display with Tommy Fury, which many viewers branded 'desperate' and 'crossing a line'
The undeterred model later stared directly into his eyes and asked him if she 'turned him on', and later suggestively sucked on a popsicle while gazing into his eyes.
When contacted by MailOnline a spokesperson for Love Island said: 'We take the emotional well-being of all the Islanders extremely seriously.
'We have dedicated welfare producers and psychological support on hand at all times who monitor and regularly speak to all of the Islanders in private and off camera, especially if someone appears to be upset.
'All the Islanders are therefore fully supported by the professionals on site and by their friends in the villa. This means Islanders are always able to reach out and talk to someone if they feel the need.
'We will of course continue to monitor all of our Islanders in line with our robust protocols. Love Island holds a mirror up to relationships and all the different dynamics that go with them.'
A source close to Joe added: 'Joe is a great guy and you can tell how much he genuinely likes Lucie. Any suggestion online that he has been ''gaslighting'' is unfair, you can see he only wants the best for Lucie and their time together in Love Island."
A representative for Ofcom said: 'We will assess these complaints against our broadcasting rules, but are yet to decide whether or not to investigate.'
Ofcom holds the power to fine broadcasters who breach its rules and say the fine is dependent on the size and turnover of the firm - fines can reach an upper limit of 10% of the broadcaster's turnover.
ITV was issued the largest fine of any broadcaster in 2008 when Ofcom charged them £5.68m for their abuse of premium phone lines on shows including Ant and Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway and Ant and Dec's Gameshow Marathon.

argos_summary: Maura Higgins has showcased a stunning transformation of her £1.25 million Essex mansion, sharing the dramatic before-and-after photos with her 3.7 million Instagram followers. The makeover features a cozy lounge with plush furnishings, warm lighting, and decorative elements, marking a significant upgrade from her previous modest living space. Following her rise to fame from Love Island, Maura has also secured a role in The Traitors USA, further solidifying her successful career in entertainment.
